bug.author: SkidanovAlex
bug.summary: Wrong link in the "common problems" docs
bug.description:
On the "Getting started page" in the following part: <denchmark-code>Common Problems GPU-related issues
If you encounter the following when trying to run a TensorFlow program:
ImportError: libcudart.so.7.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Make sure you followed the the GPU installation instructions. </denchmark-code>
The last word "instructions" leads to <denchmark-link:http://www.tensorflow.org/#install_cuda>http://www.tensorflow.org/#install_cuda</denchmark-link> , however the main page it leads to does not have an anchor "install_cuda", so it just ends up leading to the top of main page. Presumably, the correct link is <denchmark-link:http://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/os_setup.md#install_cuda>http://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/os_setup.md#install_cuda</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Thanks for the report -- our website generation is undergoing fixes / changes this week -- it is also quite behind our github documentation. We'll close this bug once we've fixed these issues, thanks!
